about.title: I just caught fire coding.
about.text_1: Ever since I became a Full-Stack developer, work doesn't feel like work anymore—it's a daily dose of joy! Coding isn't just a <>passion<>; it's an <>obsession<> that has me counting down the hours on Friday evenings, eagerly awaiting Monday to dive back in. Yep, I'm that crazy about coding!
about.text_2: Now, a little backstory: I hail from <>Madagascar<>. Back in 2014, I aced my French Baccalaureate with mathematics as my major. After that, I joined <>HEC Montreal<> for a <>Bachelor of Business Administration<>. Finance was my initial choice, but turns out, numbers alone weren't cutting it. That's when I transitioned to combining Finance with <>Information Technology<>. During my final two years, I stumbled upon IT projects from a business perspective, but it was only in my last semester, in 2018, that I took my first programming course. And bam! It hit me like a drumroll of lightning—I'd found my calling, a blend of <>creativity<> and <>problem-solving<> that set my soul on fire. I was up until 3am tackling coding challenges, driven by an inner spark.
about.text_3: Reality hit soon after graduation. I needed a job, and getting hired as a junior developer with just one course under my belt was a tall order. So, I became a Customer Manager for a French startup, but deep down, coding was my true love. Cue the <>self-taught<> grind: work all day, code all night.
about.text_4: Then 2020 happened—the year the world hit pause, thanks to Covid-19. I lost my job, but I also had family responsibilities. So, during lock down, I doubled down on my efforts. A few months later, I landed my first gig as a developer.
about.text_5: My years at <>Bizbishare<> were transformative. I grew, evolved, and became a confident <>Full-Stack developer<>. Armed with this knowledge, I then joined <>mPhase<>, diving into various projects in an <>agile<> environment. Now, I can whip up digital products from scratch to finish, just like I did with the <>NAIA<> platform. To the person who nudged me toward Finance and Information Technology at university—thank you a million times over! You set me on this incredible coding adventure, and I haven't looked back since!

form.title: I'm excited to learn about your project. Ready to get started?

about.text_1: Greetings and welcome to my portfolio! My name is <>Anja<>, and I'm thrilled that you're taking the time to explore my work. I call Antananarivo, the vibrant capital of <>Madagascar<>, my hometown. Currently, I am deeply immersed in the world of technology as a <>Full-Stack developer<> at mPhase.
about.text_2: My journey to this position has been nothing short of an exhilarating roller coaster ride. To be completely honest, the path to becoming a developer was not one I had initially envisioned. Life took me on unexpected turns and introduced me to the exciting realm of <>coding and development<>. I'm truly grateful for the opportunities that have come my way, and I'm eager to share my experiences and creations with you. <>Thank you<> once again for your visit, and I hope you enjoy exploring my work!
about.title: About me

contact.text: Interested in working together? We should queue up a chat. I'll buy the coffee.
contact.title: Start a project

frontend.title: Front-End
frontend.description: I enjoy Front-end development. I get a lot of satisfaction when I see a product coming to life on my screen.

backend.title: Back-End
backend.description: I enjoy crafting and maintaining APIs that meet industry standards. Data integrity is vital in my work.

tools.title: Tools & Workflow
tools.description: Here is a list of tools and workflow that I have been using professionally and personally so far.

bizbizshare.tagline: Meet BizbizShare, the B2B marketplace pros on a mission to make business eco-friendly! During my time there, I wore many hats as a developer. I managed our in-house marketplace and also had a blast overseeing multiple client-owned marketplaces across various industries. From industrial resources to snazzy office spaces, we were all about creating a circular economy

about.title: About Bizbizshare
about.text_1: BizbizShare specializes in circular economy <>marketplaces<>. They run their own marketplace and offer white-label solutions, all managed by a single codebase. When I joined the company, our tech setup resembled a colossal <>Jenga<> tower built entirely from vintage <>JAVA<> blocks. Picture this: it had the Herculean task of juggling authentication, subscriptions, data analysis, elasticsearch, payments, client and admin interface – you name it! The catch? If one piece decided to rebel, it sent the entire tower tumbling down like a house of cards. Not exactly a recipe for tech tranquility, right?  In response to this critical issue. the company bid a solemn farewell to the monolithic era, understanding the perils it posed as it's started its journey towards a <>microservices architecture<>, piece by piece.
about.text_2: My adventure at BizBizshare, spanning from <>August 2020<> to <>November 2021<>,  started with a clear goal: rebuild the marketplace interface and admin panel using the dynamic trio of <>React<>, <>Redux<>, and <>Vue.js<>. Our squad consisted of just three developers - one seasoned full-stack pro with three years under their belt, a part-time backend whiz who was juggling university studies, and yours truly, the only React mastermind. We were a young and vibrant team, all hovering around the ripe age of 24.
about.text_3: As time ticked on, I realized that being the sole front-end warrior often meant I was last in line to deliver features. Sometimes, things clicked seamlessly, but there were those hair-raising nights when we burned the midnight oil because a client meeting was looming on the horizon. Oddly enough, I relished the thrill, but I yearned for tranquility too. That's when I made a deliberate move to delve deep into the inner workings of the <>API<> that fueled our front-end, crafted using <>NodeJS<> and <>MySQL<>. By immersing myself in back-end development, I could smoothly connect the dots between the front and back ends, ultimately evolving into a <>Full-Stack developer<>. Consequently, come August 2021, we successfully dismantled the final piece of the monolithic puzzle. I extend heartfelt gratitude to my incredible colleagues for their unwavering support on this rollercoaster ride of growth and development.

bizbizshare.description: Bizbizshare, the in-house marketplace, prides itself on offering a unique specialization. It strive to provide a wide range of offerings, primarily focusing on warehouse inventory, equipment, real estate, human resources, and electronics.

ben.description: The Business Exchange Network, BEN, is a marketplace powered by the US Green Chamber of Commerce. It serves as a versatile gateway to numerous categories, meeting your diverse needs across the United States and worldwide.

circular.description: Circular Sharing stands as a prominent marketplace with a primary focus on Western Canada. Staying true to its name, its overarching mission revolves around empowering and nurturing an eco-friendly economy within the region.

espaces.description: Espaces et Cie primarily centers its efforts on revitalizing Montreal's downtown area. With a core mission to promote and facilitate office space rental, it caters to the diverse needs of businesses in terms of size, type, and specific requirements.

achievements.title: Achievements
achievements.introduction: I've had the privilege of working in a rewarding environment that fostered personal and professional growth. With a passion for innovation and a commitment to excellence, I've accomplished numerous achievements:

text1.title: New Marketplace Interface
text1.content: I successfully revamped the marketplace interface with React and Redux, accomplishing this within less than a year as the sole front-end developer.

text2.title: Admin Panel
text2.content: I managed to rebuild the admin panel using Vue.js, creating an efficient and user-friendly control center for streamlined operations.

text3.title: Tailored Web Solutions
text3.content: I conceptualized and constructed a bespoke, end-to-end web application, serving our client's unique needs by seamlessly connecting their API to the marketplace while implementing specialized features.

text4.title: Bridge the gap
text4.content: I played a pivotal role in maintaining and enhancing the core API, acting as the vital link that unites frontend and backend systems, ensuring optimal performance and functionality.

mphase.tagline: As a developer at mPhase, we have the privilege of engaging with a wide array of in-house projects, catering to thousands of daily users. Additionally, we extend our services to clients, enabling us to venture into various sectors and industries. This dynamic work environment is truly remarkable; each day brings fresh challenges and opportunities, making it a fast-paced, ever-evolving experience.

about.title: About mPhase
about.text_1: mPhase is a Montreal-based startup. The company is not only committed to developing products for clients but has also successfully created its own proprietary products. I became a part of the mPhase team in <>November 2021<> and continue to be an active member of the organization. Our team consists of approximately 10 developers, with some specializing in specific areas like <>Mobile Development<> or <>Back-end<>, while the majority, including myself, are Full Stack developers involved in various projects. My time at this company has been instrumental in my growth as <>a Full Stack developer.<>
about.text_2: We follow the <>agile SCRUM methodology<>, progressing from one sprint to another, and ensuring comprehensive project planning, reviews, and daily meetings. To facilitate this, we rely on a range of tools such as <>Confluence<>, <>Jira<>, <>Bitbucket<>, and <>Github<>. Each of our repositories has its own pipeline, enabling us to achieve seamless <>CI/CD<> integration.
about.text_3: On a typical day, my work involves immersing myself in multiple projects hosted in different repositories, each operating within distinct environments and employing a wide array of technologies. This technology stack spans from <>Angular<>, <>Node.js<>, and <>MongoDB<> to <>React<> and <>React Native<>. Managing tasks that encompass code reviews, quality assurance, and development, it's fair to say that multitasking has become second nature to us.

mtransport.text: mTransport, our in-house solution, serves thousands of users daily. It's a comprehensive system for schools, providing real-time bus tracking via a user-friendly website for clients and institutions. Students are equipped with their own QR code cards for efficient boarding. Bus drivers use a mobile app to scan these cards, accessing trip details for a smooth journey. Parents receive mobile app notifications for added convenience. It's the future of student transport.

astus.text: We're currently working on AstusELD, an Electronic Logging Device project for the Astus Group. This initiative is aimed at improving driver safety and streamlining the tracking, management, and sharing of duty status records. It presents unique challenges, particularly due to the need for certification in compliance with relevant laws and regulations. Our role centers around developing a React Native and Typescript-based mobile app, ensuring a smooth and efficient experience for drivers as they navigate their daily tasks and responsibilities.

scoola.text: Scoola, one of our in-house projects, is nearing its launch. This comprehensive system is specifically designed to assist child daycare facilities. It empowers daycare employees by providing them with easy access to the daily list of assigned children. In parallel, managers are equipped with a dedicated website to efficiently oversee the status of each group, ensuring that the child-to-staff ratio is maintained at optimal levels. Additionally, parents are an integral part of this ecosystem through their own mobile application.

naia.tagline: NAIA, also known as North American Immigration Agency, is currently building  a tailored solution designed specifically for immigration law firms operating in both Canada and the United States. Its primary objective is to enhance document management throughout every stage of the immigration process.

about.title: About NAIA
about.text_1: I'm currently working on a web platform for NAIA, which stands for North American Immigration Agency. It's a rather fascinating project that I've taken on during my free time. To give you a glimpse behind the scenes, I'm the sole developer responsible for crafting the platform. This involves designing the user interface, implementing the web components using <>React<> and <>Typescript<>, and building the essential REST API with <>NodeJs<>, <>MongoDB<>, and <>Google Cloud storage<>. Our deployment is on Heroku, and we've got a nifty automatic <>CI/CD<> pipeline managed by Bitbucket, our repository host.
about.text_2: The primary goal is to enhance document management for individuals pursuing immigration cases in <>Canada<> or the <>United States<>. It's all about streamlining the often cumbersome process of gathering, identifying missing or invalid documents. Currently, all these documents are housed directly in <>Google Drive<>, accessible to clients, employees, and lawyers alike. The result? Picture a scenario where everyone's diving into a virtual paper pile – not exactly a smooth sailing experience.
about.text_3: The platform caters to <>4 types<> of users, each with their unique roles and access. Luckily, I've been granted permission to provide you with a sneak peek of the platform in action on our staging environment – consider it our <>virtual playground<>. You're encouraged to <>explore<> and <>test<> any feature without hesitation. Simply click on the login button corresponding to the role you've chosen, and voilà! You'll be seamlessly whisked into the platform.

admin.title: Admin
admin.text: The admin enjoys extensive privileges, holding exclusive authority to add, update, or remove employees as needed. Within the system, they possess unrestricted access to all immigration cases. Additionally, in the foreseeable future, the admin role will encompass the management of organizations when the platform expands to offer a white label solution.

lawyer.title: Lawyer
lawyer.text: Lawyers operate within a more specialized realm. Their access is limited solely to the immigration cases they have been assigned to handle. It's worth noting that each immigration case is required to have at least one lawyer assigned to it. While lawyers do have the capability to initiate new immigration cases, their purview does not extend to employee management functions.

employee.title: Employee
employee.text: Employees, being the foundation of the operational structure, have a focused scope of access. They are confined to the immigration cases specifically assigned to them. As the backbone of case management, their responsibilities predominantly revolve around guiding and facilitating the case through its various procedural stages.

client.title: Client
client.text: Clients are provided with a simplified interface, granting them access solely to their designated areas and their own pertinent documents. This tailored perspective is designed to offer clients a user-friendly experience, facilitating straightforward case tracking and the seamless uploading of necessary documents when the need arises.
